ğŸ›¡ï¸ The "Vero Core Law" Checklist (MANDATORY)

STOP! If your PR violates these core principles, it will be automatically
rejected.

$$$$

Zero Dependencies: I certify that I have NOT added any runtime dependencies
(npm: or jsr:) to the Core logic.

$$$$

Web Standards First: I used universal APIs (globalThis, console) instead of
runtime-specific ones (process, Deno.*), ensuring compatibility across Browsers,
Node, and Deno.

$$$$

Composition over Inheritance: I respected the architecture of wrapping the
native console rather than extending it unsafely.

âœ… Quality Assurance

$$$$

My code follows the style guidelines of this project (deno fmt passed).

$$$$

I have performed a self-review of my own code.

$$$$

I have added JSDoc comments to public interfaces/functions.

$$$$

I have made corresponding changes to the documentation.

$$$$

My changes generate no new linting warnings.

$$$$

I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

$$$$

New and existing unit tests pass locally.

ğŸŒ³ Git Conventions

$$$$

My branch name follows the pattern: type/short-description (e.g.,
feat/add-json-parser).

$$$$

My commits follow the Conventional Commits specification (e.g., feat: add json
parser).
